messages.subject: clocks
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/10/02 3:48:23 PM, BSOLLARS@JUNO.COM writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/10/02 3:48:23 PM, BSOLLARS@... writes:

<< She still only uses the bedroom clock because she
hasn't memorized the hand clock and thinks it's a waste of time to count
by fives when she can just run into my room and read the digital. >>

When my kids were all little, the boys only read digital clocks, and Holly
only read analog. I loved when they would be in a public place, and one
would ask the other what time it was (depending on what clock they could see,
and who could read it).

We never "taught" them to read any of those, but they learned in part from
Playroom and Treasure Math Storm (I think it was), both of which had clock
games in them.

Sandra
